result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rico Lashawn Smith

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rico Lashawn Smith in court.  Attorney Imran Kurter in court for Rico Lashawn Smith. Attorney Jeffrey Purnell in court as a friend of the court for Rico Lashawn Smith. Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Status conference held. Attorney Kurter's motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Attorney Purnell provides an update to the court. Defendant plans on hiring Attorney Beau Brindley. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rico Lashawn Smith appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Status conference held. Defendant did not contact the PD's Office. Defendant advises the Court he has retained private counsel. Court orders matter adjourned for an in person status of counsel hearing in branch 29.
Status conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Rico Lashawn Smith in court.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Pre-Trial Conference. Court is advised that the defendant still has yet to be represented by SPD in this court matter. Court orders defendant to be re-interviewed by SPD. Case adjourned for Status of Counsel to Br 29.  Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant previously posted $6,500 cash bail. Court orders cash bail returned to the remitter. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KWN.

Defendant Rico Lashawn Smith in court.  Samuel Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 29.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
